contentrichtext.text: '''Bahnam Zaya Bulos''' ([[Arabic]]: بهنام زيا بولص; born 1944) was Minister of Transport in the cabinet appointed by the [[Interim Iraq Governing Council]] in September 2003. A member of Iraq's [[Assyrian people|Assyrian]] [[Christian]] minority, Bulos is originally from [[Baghdad]], where he worked as a [[civil engineer]]. ==References== * {{cite web| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/3199561.stm| title=Iraq's post-war cabinet| accessdate=2006-02-24| author=BBC News| date=2003-09-01}} {{S-start}} {{succession box | title=Minister of Transport| before=[[Coalition Provisional Authority]]| years= September 2003–June 2004| after=[[Louei Hatim Sultan al-Aris]] }} {{S-end}} {{Persondata | name = Bulos, Bahnam Zaya | alternative names = | short description = | date of birth = 1944 | place of birth = | date of death = | place of death = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bulos, Bahnam Zaya}} [[Category:Assyrian politicians]] [[Category:Iraqi Christians]] [[Category:Government ministers of Iraq]] [[Category:1944 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Assyrian people]] [[Category:People from Baghdad]] {{Iraq-politician-stub}}
